intro: Lasianthus biermannii subsp. crassipedunculatus, commonly known as the broad-panicle lasianthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows as an herb or shrub, with lance-shaped leaves and tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and for horticultural purposes.
